overall_summary: The reasoning process demonstrates a practical approach to short-term forecasting with limited data. After evaluating multiple methods (SARIMA, Exponential Smoothing), the analyst selected a simple hourly averaging technique due to data constraints (4 days of history). The approach acknowledges limitations in capturing trends and weekday patterns but provides a baseline solution through manual computation of 24-hour cyclical averages repeated across forecast days.
common_data_patterns: No missing values in provided sample
key_insights: Prioritized simplicity due to limited historical data (4 days) constraining complex model effectiveness
Addressed day-of-week pattern challenges (forecasting weekdays from history containing weekends)
Used manual hourly averaging as fallback when statistical models became impractical without code execution
Maintained 3-decimal precision consistency with input data format
Acknowledged trade-off between model sophistication and data limitations in final implementation
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex initial analysis with statistical model comparisons, transitioning to heuristic implementation. Demonstrated multi-step reasoning about seasonality and data limitations, though ultimately employed simple arithmetic averaging due to practical constraints.
